Sure! Let's identify the "Disease" entities mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Normal hemolytic titers: This is not a disease entity. It refers to a measurement of the ability of blood serum to cause the lysis (breakdown) of red blood cells.

2. Homozygous C5-deficient (C5D) sera: This refers to a condition where individuals have a deficiency in the C5 protein, which is involved in the complement system of the immune system. It can be considered a disease entity.

So, the disease entity mentioned in the paragraph is "homozygous C5-deficient (C5D) sera".
